com.bumptech.glide.resize
Class ImageManager

java.lang.Object
  com.bumptech.glide.resize.ImageManager

public class ImageManager
extends java.lang.Object

A class to coordinate image loading, resizing, recycling, and caching. Depending on the provided options and the sdk version, uses a combination of an LRU disk cache and an LRU hard memory cache to try to reduce the number of load and resize operations performed and to maximize the number of times Bitmaps are recycled as opposed to allocated. If no options are given defaults to using both a memory and a disk cache and to recycling bitmaps if possible.

Note that Bitmap recycling is only available on Honeycomb and up.

Method Detail

getSafeMemoryCacheSize

public static int getSafeMemoryCacheSize(android.content.Context context)
Get the maximum safe memory cache size for this particular device based on the # of mb allocated to each app. This is a conservative estimate that has been safe for 2.2+ devices consistently. It is probably rather small for newer devices.

Parameters:
context - A context
Returns:
The maximum safe size for the memory cache for this devices in bytes

getPhotoCacheDir

public static java.io.File getPhotoCacheDir(android.content.Context context)
Try to get the external cache directory if available and default to the internal. Use a default name for the cache directory if no name is provided

Parameters:
context - A context
Returns:
A File representing the default disk cache directory

public java.lang.Object getImage(java.lang.String id,
                                 StreamLoader streamLoader,
                                 LoadedCallback cb)
Loads the image at its original dimensions.

Parameters:
id - A string id that uniquely identifies the image to be loaded. It may include the width and height, but is not required to do so
streamLoader - The StreamLoader that will be used to load the image if it is not cached
cb - The callback called when the load completes
Returns:
A token tracking this request

height - The desired height of the slice
cb - The callback called when the task finishes

                                  StreamLoader streamLoader,
                                  int width,
                                  int height,
                                  LoadedCallback cb)
Loads the image for the given id and resizes it, maintaining the original proportions, so that the image fills an area of width*height.

Parameters:

width - The width of the space
height - The height of the space
cb - The callback called when the task finishes
Returns:
A token tracking this request

rejectBitmap

public void rejectBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap b)
Notify the ImageManager that a bitmap it loaded is not going to be displayed and can go into a queue to be reused. Does nothing if recycling is disabled or impossible.

Parameters:
b - The rejected Bitmap

acquireBitmap

public void acquireBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap b)
Notify the ImageManager that a Bitmap it loaded is going to be used and increment the reference counter for that Bitmap. Though it won't cause a memory leak, we expect releaseBitmap to be called for this Bitmap at some point. If release is not called, then we will never be able to recycle the Bitmap. Does nothing if recycling is disabled or impossible.

Parameters:
b - The acquired Bitmap

releaseBitmap

public void releaseBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap b)
Notify the ImageManager that a Bitmap it loaded is no longer being used and decrement the reference counter for that Bitmap. This will cause an exception if acquire was not called first, or if each call to release does not come after a call to acquire. If the reference count drops to zero, places the Bitmap into a queue to be recycled. Does nothing if recycling is disabled or impossible.

Parameters:
b - The releasedBitmap

cancelTask

public void cancelTask(java.lang.Object token)
Cancel the task represented by the given token. If token is null this call will be ignored.

Parameters:
token - The token returned by the ImageManager in a get call

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shuts down all of the background threads used by the ImageManager including the executor service
